LABEL: 0x5e
JPN: 一晩経ったけど、まったく、記憶が戻る気配はない。
ENG: Even after the night passed, there wasn't even the slightest hint of my memories returning.

LABEL: 0x9e
JPN: 島を散策してみても、手がかりもない。
ENG: I tried exploring around the island, but didn't find a single clue.

LABEL: 0xd2
JPN: でも、不思議とどこを歩いても迷うことはなかった。
ENG: Oddly enough, though, no matter where I walked I never lost my way.

LABEL: 0x112
JPN: 僕はこの島にくるのは初めてじゃないということかな。
ENG: I wonder if that means this isn't my first time on this island?

LABEL: 0x154
JPN: 誰も僕のことを知らないから、島民ということはないみたいだけど。
ENG: Though since nobody seems to know me, it looks like I'm not an islander myself.

LABEL: 0x1c8
JPN: 所持品と言えば、最初から着ていたこの服だけ。
ENG: As far as personal belongings went, I had the clothes I'd been wearing since the very beginning, and nothing else.

LABEL: 0x204
ENG: My pockets were empty, too.

LABEL: 0x226
ENG: ...Huh? No, actually, there's something in there after all.

LABEL: 0x250
ENG: A single feather.

LABEL: 0x26a
JPN: 鳥の羽かな。あるいは虫とか？
ENG: I guess it's from a bird. Or maybe it's the wing of some weird bug?

LABEL: 0x2bc
ENG: "Hey, take a look at this."

LABEL: 0x300
ENG: "What?"

LABEL: 0x322
ENG: "What kind of feather do you think this is?"

LABEL: 0x35c
ENG: "Hmm."

LABEL: 0x37c
ENG: "...Maybe it's Catherine's?"

LABEL: 0x3c0
ENG: "'Catherine'?"

LABEL: 0x3ea
JPN: 「なんでもないです。鶏さんの羽ですか？」
ENG: "Don't worry about it! Is it a chicken feather?"

LABEL: 0x43a
ENG: "No, it's not."

LABEL: 0x46c
ENG: "It's not even a bird's feather in the first place."

LABEL: 0x4ae
JPN: 「これがポケットに入っていたと？」
ENG: "You found this in your pocket?"

LABEL: 0x4e8
ENG: "Right."

LABEL: 0x518
JPN: 「おまえは、一体どこから来たのやら」
ENG: "Just where the hell did you come from?"

LABEL: 0x554
ENG: "Hey, rude."

LABEL: 0x586
ENG: "What?"

LABEL: 0x5a8
JPN: 「お・ま・え。乱暴になっています」
ENG: "The way you're talking to me. It's getting all rough again."

LABEL: 0x5f2
ENG: "Mmph."

LABEL: 0x622
ENG: "Ahem."

LABEL: 0x654
JPN: 「あなたはずいぶん遠くからきたのかもしれないな」
ENG: "I suppose you might have come from a long ways away, don't you think?"

LABEL: 0x6bc
ENG: "That was kinda creepy."

LABEL: 0x6f8
ENG: "The hell do you want from me!?"

LABEL: 0x722
JPN: 「おまえさんで良いじゃないですか。なんで、『あなた』を選ぶんですか」
ENG: "Can't you just talk to me normally? Why are you overdoing it?"

LABEL: 0x78e
JPN: 「より丁寧にを、心がけたまでの話だ」
ENG: "I was trying to keep politeness in mind."

LABEL: 0x7ca
JPN: とりあえず、分かったことがある。
ENG: For the moment, there's one thing I understand clearly.

LABEL: 0x7fa
ENG: This old man...

LABEL: 0x818
JPN: 小鳩さんは、とにかく不器用な人だ。
ENG: Kobato-san... is a fundamentally awkward person.

LABEL: 0x8a8
JPN: おじーさんは早朝というより深夜に家を出て、昼ごろ帰ってくる。
ENG: He left the house so early in the morning it almost felt more natural to call it late at night, and returned around lunchtime.

LABEL: 0x8f4
JPN: それから家の用事を簡単にすませると寝てしまう。
ENG: Then he made short work of the household chores and fell asleep.

LABEL: 0x932
JPN: しろはちゃんは朝から１人で遊びに行って、昼ご飯を食べにいったん帰ってきて……また夕方まで外に行っている。
ENG: Shiroha-chan went out to play on her own in the morning, but she came home for lunch... then went right back outside until the evening.

LABEL: 0x9aa
JPN: どこで遊んでいるんだろう？
ENG: I wonder where she went to play?

LABEL: 0x9f4
ENG: As for me...

LABEL: 0xa0c
ENG: I had nothing to do.

LABEL: 0xa30
JPN: この感覚もどうしてか、覚えがある。
ENG: I didn't know why, but it felt like I'd experienced that sort of boredom before.

LABEL: 0xa62
JPN: 夏なのに、ただ何もしないで時間だけを潰す。
ENG: Even though it was summer, I whiled away the time in complete idleness.

LABEL: 0xa9c
JPN: 記憶があるときの僕は、夏をどういう風に過ごしていたんだろう。
ENG: I wonder how I spent my summers before I lost my memories?

LABEL: 0xae8
JPN: 誰かと遊んでいたのか。
ENG: Did I hang out with anyone?

LABEL: 0xb0e
ENG: Or did I do my own thing?

LABEL: 0xbac
ENG: "Thanks for the food."

LABEL: 0xbec
ENG: "Thanks for the food."

LABEL: 0xc28
JPN: 食卓に並ぶお夕飯は、一見豪華だった。
ENG: At a glance, tonight's dinner was extravagant.

LABEL: 0xc5c
JPN: 新鮮な魚のお刺身、タコのお刺身、採れたてのワカメ、活きの良い海老。
ENG: Freshly caught fish and octopus sashimi, just-harvested seaweed, and beautifully colored shrimp.

LABEL: 0xcae
JPN: 全部、おじーさんが釣ってきたものだ。
ENG: The old man had caught all of them himself.

LABEL: 0xce2
ENG: However...

LABEL: 0xcfa
ENG: We had the same thing, every single day.

LABEL: 0xd1c
ENG: It was fresh and delicious, but...

LABEL: 0xd74
ENG: Shiroha ate with a blank look on her face.

LABEL: 0xd98
JPN: 毎日お刺身というのは、子供にはちょっとつらいんじゃないのかな。
ENG: I bet eating sashimi every single day's kinda tough on a kid.

LABEL: 0xea2
JPN: 夜になると、僕はまた外を出歩いていた。
ENG: Night fell, and I went out for a walk again.

LABEL: 0xed8
JPN: 目覚めた場所に近づけば、少しは無くしている記憶に近づけるかもしれない。
ENG: I thought that being closer to the place where I'd woken up might bring me closer to recovering my memories, too.

LABEL: 0xf2e
JPN: そんなことはなかったけど。
ENG: Of course, nothing of the sort happened.

LABEL: 0xf7e
ENG: I just stood there, doing nothing.

LABEL: 0xfa2
ENG: Unable to do anything.

LABEL: 0xfc2
JPN: 夏が過ぎていくのを待っている。
ENG: Waiting for summer to end.

LABEL: 0xff0
ENG: Can I really carry on like this?

LABEL: 0x102e
ENG: No, I don't think so.

LABEL: 0x104e
JPN: 何かしないと何も変わらない。
ENG: If I don't make a move, nothing will change.

LABEL: 0x107a
ENG: First things first.

LABEL: 0x1162
ENG: "Thanks for the food."

LABEL: 0x11ae
ENG: Those emotionless mealtimes.

LABEL: 0x11d0
ENG: They'll have to go.

LABEL: 0x1282
JPN: しろはちゃんのご飯を作ってあげよう。
ENG: I'll cook something for Shiroha-chan.

LABEL: 0x12ce
ENG: ...Wait.

LABEL: 0x12e8
JPN: 僕は料理なんてできるのか？
ENG: Do I even know how to cook?

LABEL: 0x1312
JPN: でも、どうしてか、そうしてあげたいと思った。
ENG: I have my doubts, but for some reason I have a strong feeling that that's what I should do for her.

LABEL: 0x134e
JPN: これは僕が忘れてしまった記憶なのかな。
ENG: I wonder if my missing memories are influencing me somehow?

LABEL: 0x1384
ENG: I'm not sure.

LABEL: 0x13a0
ENG: I'm not sure, but...

LABEL: 0x13c0
JPN: だから、してみることにする。
ENG: That's just all the more reason to give it a try and find out.

LABEL: 0x1504
ENG: The next day.

LABEL: 0x151a
ENG: "Hmmm."

LABEL: 0x153a
JPN: 僕は冷蔵庫を覗いていた。
ENG: I peeked into the refrigerator.

LABEL: 0x1562
JPN: 何かありあわせのもので、作れるものはないかな。
ENG: I tried to look for anything I could throw together to make a proper meal.

LABEL: 0x15a0
ENG: I scanned the ingredients...

LABEL: 0x15be
JPN: ふと、頭に作る料理が浮かんできた。
ENG: And suddenly, a certain dish popped into my head.

LABEL: 0x15f0
ENG: "All right!"

LABEL: 0x1642
ENG: ...Twenty minutes later.

LABEL: 0x16cc
JPN: 炒められたご飯の残りに、刻んだ野菜と魚介の切れ端が混ぜられて、じゅぅじゅぅと音をたてている。
ENG: I tossed some finely chopped vegetables and leftover fish meat into the pan, mixing them into the sizzling leftover rice I'd been stir-frying.

LABEL: 0x1738
ENG: Why fried rice, though?

LABEL: 0x175a
JPN: 自分で思いながらも作ってみると妙に手際よくできた。
ENG: I wondered at my own decision as I put the dish together. I was oddly good at it.

LABEL: 0x179c
JPN: まるでこれまで何度も作ってきたように。
ENG: It was like I'd made the dish countless times before.

LABEL: 0x1828
JPN: 匂いに釣られたのか、しろはちゃんが顔を出す。
ENG: Perhaps lured in by the smell, Shiroha-chan poked her head into the kitchen.

LABEL: 0x1874
ENG: "What're you making?"

LABEL: 0x189e
ENG: "The mother of all rice dishes."

LABEL: 0x18dc
ENG: "Eh?"

LABEL: 0x18fc
ENG: She was surprised.

LABEL: 0x1928
JPN: 「かーちゃん？　かーちゃん作ってるの？」
ENG: "Mother? You're making a mom?"

LABEL: 0x197a
ENG: "That's incredible."

LABEL: 0x19ac
ENG: "No, no."

LABEL: 0x19d0
ENG: "It's fried rice."

LABEL: 0x1a28
JPN: しろはちゃんは、フライパンの中を見ながら考えこむ。
ENG: Shiroha-chan gazed into the frying pan, deep in thought.

LABEL: 0x1a6a
ENG: "You mean a stir-fry?"

LABEL: 0x1a98
ENG: "Nope! Fried rice."

LABEL: 0x1ad6
ENG: "But that's a stir-fry."

LABEL: 0x1b08
ENG: "It's fried rice."

LABEL: 0x1b3e
ENG: "Fried rice."

LABEL: 0x1b66
JPN: しろはちゃんが少し不思議そうに繰り返した。
ENG: Shiroha-chan repeated the words, seemingly mystified.

LABEL: 0x1ba0
JPN: 僕は仕上げに、醤油をご飯に触れないようフライパンの端に入れる。
ENG: For the finishing touch, I poured soy sauce into the side of the pan so it wouldn't touch the rice.

LABEL: 0x1bee
JPN: そして、胡椒を振りかけ、もうひとかき混ぜして火を止めた。
ENG: Then I topped it with pepper, mixed it all together, and turned the heat off.

LABEL: 0x1ccc
ENG: "It's finished!"

LABEL: 0x1cee
ENG: "Here you go."

LABEL: 0x1d2e
ENG: "Eh?"

LABEL: 0x1d5e
ENG: "I-I don't want it."

LABEL: 0x1d8a
ENG: "No way!"

LABEL: 0x1dac
JPN: 「しろはちゃんのために作ったのに」
ENG: "I made it just for you!"

LABEL: 0x1df6
ENG: "M-Mind your own business."

LABEL: 0x1e24
ENG: "No way..."

LABEL: 0x1e52
ENG: Grr...

LABEL: 0x1e78
ENG: "Ah."

LABEL: 0x1e98
ENG: Her stomach rumbled.

LABEL: 0x1eea
ENG: And her face turned bright red.

LABEL: 0x1f0a
ENG: "Go ahead."

LABEL: 0x1f68
JPN: 赤くなりながらも、小さく頷いた。
ENG: Still blushing, she gave a little nod.

LABEL: 0x1f98
ENG: She took a cautious bite.

LABEL: 0x2006
ENG: "Tasty."

LABEL: 0x202c
ENG: "Thank goodness!"

LABEL: 0x2050
JPN: 「お刺身ばかりだと飽きるよね」
ENG: "It gets boring eating sashimi all the time, right?"

LABEL: 0x209e
ENG: "...Yeah."

LABEL: 0x20c4
ENG: "You should just tell him."

LABEL: 0x20fe
JPN: 「でもせっかくとってきてくれたものだし」
ENG: "But he catches them just for me, and all."

LABEL: 0x2140
ENG: "Acting that considerate just makes you feel distant, you know?"

LABEL: 0x2182
ENG: "Distant?"

LABEL: 0x21ac
JPN: 「ああいうのはちょっと厳しく言わないと分からないよ」
ENG: "For stuff like this, you have to be a bit harsh or he won't get it."

LABEL: 0x21f8
JPN: 「刺身なんていい加減飽きたんだよ！」
ENG: "I'm friggin' sick of all this stupid sashimi!"

LABEL: 0x2234
ENG: "...Like that."

LABEL: 0x227a
ENG: "Well, excuse me, then."

LABEL: 0x22a6
ENG: "Uwaaaaah!"

LABEL: 0x22ca
ENG: "It's the sashimi!"

LABEL: 0x2300
ENG: "Who're you calling sashimi?"

LABEL: 0x234e
ENG: "And what're you eating?"

LABEL: 0x2388
ENG: "A stir-fry."

LABEL: 0x23ae
ENG: "Fried rice."

LABEL: 0x23d4
JPN: しろはちゃんと無言で見つめ合う。
ENG: Shiroha silently locked eyes with me.

LABEL: 0x2404
JPN: お互い、譲れないなにかがあるみたい。
ENG: Looks like neither of us intend to back down on this.

LABEL: 0x2438
JPN: おじーさんは、そんな僕たちを見て、ため息をひとつ吐いた。
ENG: The old man watched the two of us and heaved a heavy sigh.

LABEL: 0x2480
ENG: "...You made this, Nanami?"

LABEL: 0x24b0
JPN: 「はい。冷蔵庫お借りしました。大丈夫でした？」
ENG: "I did, with some stuff from the fridge. I hope you don't mind?"

LABEL: 0x24f6
JPN: 「かまわんが……わしももらうぞ」
ENG: "I don't, but... I'll be having some, too."

LABEL: 0x252e
ENG: "Go ahead, please do!"

LABEL: 0x2556
JPN: どしっと、テーブルの前に座り、チャーハンを食べ始める。
ENG: He settled down at the table and began to eat.

LABEL: 0x25de
ENG: "This is great."

LABEL: 0x2602
ENG: "But, it's..."

LABEL: 0x262e
ENG: "Is something wrong?"

LABEL: 0x266a
ENG: "No."

LABEL: 0x268a
JPN: 何かを隠す様に、チャーハンを口に運ぶ。
ENG: He shoved more fried rice into his mouth, as if he was trying to hide something.

LABEL: 0x26c0
JPN: 僕のチャーハン……美味しくなかったのかな。
ENG: Was my fried rice... not actually very good?

LABEL: 0x26fa
JPN: おじーさんはしばらく黙ってチャーハンを食べていた。
ENG: For a time, he ate in total silence.

LABEL: 0x274c
ENG: "So, tired of sashimi, are you?"

LABEL: 0x277e
JPN: おもむろに言ってきた。
ENG: He spoke up abruptly.

LABEL: 0x27b4
ENG: "I'm sorry."

LABEL: 0x27ee
ENG: "N-No, it's fine."

LABEL: 0x282c
JPN: 「わしは、釣ってさばくことしか出来ないからな」
ENG: "Catching fish and cleaning them's all I'm good at, that's all."

LABEL: 0x2872
JPN: 「この前キャサリンを手にかけていたじゃないですか」
ENG: "But you made short work of Catherine a while back, didn't you?"

LABEL: 0x28cc
ENG: "Catherine?"

LABEL: 0x28f4
ENG: "The fried chicken."

LABEL: 0x292e
JPN: 「あぁ。あれは、近所に鶏を譲っているんだ」
ENG: "Ahh. I gave that chicken to the neighbors."

LABEL: 0x2970
JPN: 「そのお礼に料理したものをわけてもらっていただけだな。わしは料理なんてできない」
ENG: "They just gave me a portion of what they made with it in thanks. I can't cook at all."

LABEL: 0x29e8
JPN: 「ふむ……そうか。七海は料理ができるのか」
ENG: "Hmm... I see. You're the cooking sort, Nanami?"

LABEL: 0x2a2a
ENG: "Looks like."

LABEL: 0x2a50
JPN: チャーハン以外、作れる気がしないけど。
ENG: Though I got the feeling I couldn't make anything other than fried rice.

LABEL: 0x2a96
JPN: 「よかったら、しろはのために時々料理を……」
ENG: "If you don't mind cooking for Shiroha every once in a while..."

LABEL: 0x2b1a
JPN: 「あんたにそんなことさせるわけにはいかない」
ENG: "I can't ask something like that of you."

LABEL: 0x2b74
ENG: Again.

LABEL: 0x2b8c
JPN: おじーさん、何かを隠そうとしている。
ENG: He's definitely hiding something from me.

LABEL: 0x2bc0
JPN: 「そうですか？　僕はかまいませんよ。どうせ暇ですし」
ENG: "You think so? I wouldn't mind at all, though. It's not like I have anything else to do."

LABEL: 0x2c0c
ENG: "No, it's fine."

LABEL: 0x2c44
ENG: "When all's said and done, you're our guest."

LABEL: 0x2c74
ENG: "Right..."

LABEL: 0x2cf8
JPN: おじーさんはさっさと完食して部屋に引っ込んでしまった。
ENG: He cleaned his dish in a hurry and shut himself up in his room.

LABEL: 0x2d3e
JPN: しろはちゃんは、少しずつ少しずつ味わって食べている。
ENG: Shiroha ate her fried rice slowly, savoring each and every bite.

LABEL: 0x2d82
JPN: 何か、考え込んでいるみたいだった。
ENG: She seemed like she was deep in thought about something.

LABEL: 0x2dcc
ENG: "This is..."

LABEL: 0x2dee
ENG: "...Dad's flavor."

LABEL: 0x2e1a
ENG: "Huh?"

LABEL: 0x2e6a
JPN: しろはちゃんは、チャーハンを見つめながら何かを考えている。
ENG: Shiroha-chan stared at the fried rice, still thinking.

LABEL: 0x2eb4
ENG: "Umm."

LABEL: 0x2eee
ENG: "I want to learn the recipe."

LABEL: 0x2f22
ENG: "For this?"

LABEL: 0x2f60
ENG: She nodded enthusiastically.

LABEL: 0x2f82
ENG: "Sure, but..."

LABEL: 0x2fa6
JPN: 「僕も感覚で作っただけだからね。ちゃんと教えられるかなぁ」
ENG: "I just made it by instinct, myself. I'm not sure if I can really teach it well."

LABEL: 0x2ff8
JPN: 「それにおじーさん、僕が料理するの、あんまり良く思ってなかったみたいだね」
ENG: "Plus, I don't think your grandpa was very happy about me cooking."

LABEL: 0x306a
ENG: "Really?"

LABEL: 0x308e
JPN: チャーハンをこの家で作ったら、匂いでバレてしまう。
ENG: If we made fried rice in this house, he'd know from the smell.

LABEL: 0x30d0
JPN: 客人とは言われたけど、実際お世話になっているのは僕の方だ。
ENG: He called me a guest, and I couldn't deny that he was always taking care of me.

LABEL: 0x311a
JPN: あまり、おじーさんの意に添わないことはしたくない。
ENG: If possible, I'd rather avoid going against his wishes.

LABEL: 0x315c
JPN: きっとそれがせめてもの礼儀だし。
ENG: It was the least I could do, in terms of courtesy.

LABEL: 0x318c
JPN: とはいっても、しろはちゃんのお願い事も聞いてあげたい。
ENG: But even so, I wanted to hear out Shiroha-chan's request.

LABEL: 0x31e2
ENG: "Well, then..."

LABEL: 0x320e
JPN: 「私の秘密の場所も教えてあげる」
ENG: "I'll bring you to my secret place."

LABEL: 0x3248
ENG: "Your secret place?"

LABEL: 0x3288
JPN: 「うん。そこでなら、気にせずに作れるよ」
ENG: "Yeah. We can make it without bothering him over there."

LABEL: 0x3302
JPN: しろはちゃんに連れてこられたのは、坂を下ったところにあった小さなお店だった。
ENG: Shiroha-chan brought me to a little shop a ways down the hill.

LABEL: 0x3384
ENG: "What is this place...?"

LABEL: 0x33aa
JPN: 客席と、壁にかかったメニュー表。
ENG: There were counter seats, and a single menu was posted on the wall.

LABEL: 0x33da
JPN: たくさんのお皿に、大きなガスレンジ。
ENG: Lots of plates lined the shelves, and there was a big gas stove top.

LABEL: 0x340e
JPN: 人は居ないけど、ここは食堂だ。
ENG: Nobody else was inside, but it seemed to be a restaurant, or maybe a diner.

LABEL: 0x343c
ENG: "Is it closed?"

LABEL: 0x346a
JPN: 店の中自体はとても綺麗だし、普通に営業しているような佇まいだった。
ENG: The interior was perfectly clean, and by all appearances it seemed like it should be in operation.

LABEL: 0x34bc
JPN: でも、それなのに人が動いていた気配がない。
ENG: However, there didn't seem to be anyone at all staffing the place.

LABEL: 0x34f6
JPN: 僕たちが入るまで、時が止まっているようだった。
ENG: It was like the time inside had been stopped right up until we'd entered.

LABEL: 0x3554
ENG: "Yeah..."

LABEL: 0x357a
JPN: 「ここで、おとーさんが作ってたの」
ENG: "Dad cooked here."

LABEL: 0x35c8
JPN: そう言ってしろはちゃんは、お店の中を見回す。
ENG: Shiroha looked around the diner as she spoke.

LABEL: 0x3668
JPN: 「おかーさんは、あんまり料理できなくて」
ENG: "Mom wasn't very good at cooking."

LABEL: 0x36ba
ENG: "But she loved to eat."

LABEL: 0x36fe
JPN: 「だからいつもおとーさんが作って、手伝っていたの」
ENG: "So she always helped Dad while he was cooking."

LABEL: 0x375a
ENG: "But, just before summer..."

LABEL: 0x379c
JPN: 「おとーさんは、事故で死んじゃった」
ENG: "Dad died in an accident."

LABEL: 0x37ea
JPN: 「その後、おかーさんも、どこかに行ったの」
ENG: "After that, Mom went away somewhere, too."

LABEL: 0x382e
JPN: しろはちゃんのおとーさんとおかーさんのことは、おじーさんから聞いていた。
ENG: I'd already heard about her mom and dad from her grandfather.

LABEL: 0x3886
JPN: でも、改めて小さな女の子のしろはちゃんから聞かされると。
ENG: But hearing it again, directly from the little girl herself...

LABEL: 0x38ce
ENG: It really tugged at my heartstrings.

LABEL: 0x3914
JPN: ふと、しろはちゃんが店の天井の方を見た。
ENG: Suddenly, Shiroha-chan looked up at the ceiling.

LABEL: 0x394c
ENG: I followed her gaze.

LABEL: 0x3a04
ENG: I could see the sky through a window.

LABEL: 0x3a2a
JPN: 青くて白くて、眩しい空。
ENG: It was a dazzling mixture of blue and white.

LABEL: 0x3a52
JPN: 何度も見てきたはずの、夏の空だった。
ENG: A summer sky like I was sure I'd seen many times before.

LABEL: 0x3a96
JPN: 「おかーさんはね、どこか遠いところにいるの」
ENG: "Mom's out there somewhere far, far away."

LABEL: 0x3adc
ENG: "Somewhere far away?"

LABEL: 0x3b14
ENG: "Yeah."

LABEL: 0x3b46
JPN: 「もしかしたらおとーさんを探してるかも」
ENG: "She might be searching for Dad."

LABEL: 0x3b98
ENG: "Since they really liked each other."

LABEL: 0x3bca
JPN: そう言いながら、しろはちゃんは、目元を震わせていた。
ENG: Shiroha's expression began to quiver as she spoke.

LABEL: 0x3d32
ENG: "A month ago."

LABEL: 0x3d74
JPN: 「あの子の父親が事故で亡くなった。島を離れて仕入れに行った先だった」
ENG: "Her father passed away in an accident. He went out to do some shopping on the mainland."

LABEL: 0x3dd0
JPN: 「あの子が父親に再会したのは、通夜の時……棺桶の中で冷たくなった姿だった」
ENG: "The next time she saw him, it was at his wake... and he was in a casket."

LABEL: 0x3e32
JPN: 「それからほどなく、しろはの母親は……わしの娘は、姿を消した」
ENG: "Not long after that, Shiroha's mother... my daughter... disappeared."

LABEL: 0x3e98
JPN: 「あの子の前から、両親がいなくなった」
ENG: "Her parents vanished before her eyes."

LABEL: 0x3ed6
JPN: 「それからまだ１月しかたっていない」
ENG: "It's only been a month since then."

LABEL: 0x3f12
JPN: 「難しい子に見えるかもしれないが」
ENG: "She might look like a problem child to you, but..."

LABEL: 0x3f4c
JPN: 「起こったことを考えれば、がんばっているほうだ」
ENG: "Considering what happened, she's doing her best."

LABEL: 0x3fa4
ENG: "She's a splendid child."

LABEL: 0x3fca
JPN: 「わしの前でも、ほとんど泣いたりしない」
ENG: "She almost never cries in front of me."

LABEL: 0x404e
JPN: もしかして、空を見上げているのは、涙をこぼさないため？
ENG: Could it be she was looking at the sky to keep herself from crying?

LABEL: 0x4094
ENG: Since if she cried...

LABEL: 0x40b4
JPN: 涙をこぼしてしまうと。
ENG: If she shed a tear...

LABEL: 0x40da
JPN: 悲しい出来事が本当だと自分で認めてしまうから。
ENG: It'd mean she'd accepted that all those horrible things had really happened.

LABEL: 0x4118
ENG: She was putting up what very little resistance she could manage.

LABEL: 0x413c
JPN: だとしたら、それは……あまりにも辛い。
ENG: If that were true, then it'd be... just way too tragic.

LABEL: 0x4172
JPN: しろはちゃんは、店の奥に行くと、ホウキとチリトリを持ってきた。
ENG: Shiroha-chan went into the back of the store and came out again with a broom and a dustpan.

LABEL: 0x41c0
JPN: そして、黙って掃除を始める。
ENG: She began silently cleaning.

LABEL: 0x41ec
JPN: このお店が１ヶ月の間、人が来なくても綺麗だったのはこういうことか。
ENG: So this is why the diner's so well kept, even a month after people stopped coming here.

LABEL: 0x423e
JPN: 僕たちは、２人で店の掃除をした。
ENG: We cleaned the diner together.

LABEL: 0x426e
JPN: この場所が変わらないようにと。
ENG: We'd keep this place from changing.

LABEL: 0x429c
JPN: そんな願いを込めながら。
ENG: Or so I wished as I worked.
